intro: Bunium brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fennel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The botanical characteristics of Bunium brevifolium make it easily identifiable and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
